intro: Sphaeralcea rusbyi subsp. eremicola, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its adaptations include a deep root system and drought-resistant foliage, making it well-suited to harsh desert conditions.
